name: The Belvedere

reviews.text: My mom and I recently spent 7 nights at the Belvedere and would definitly recommend it. The room was a good size with 2 double beds and included microwave, small fridge and coffee maker. We stocked up on fruit, yogurt and water at the corner store and enjoyed breakfast before we started out most mornings. The Belvedere is within a very short walk to theatres, Time Square and 2 Subway lines. The staff was friendly and helpful. The concierge was extremely helpful with subway directions etc. It is hard to get an elevator in the morning as everyone seems to go out at once. We had asked for a lower room and received one on the 5th floor so it was an easy walk down to the lobby in the morning.
reviews.title: Would definitly recommend!
Should be 4 stars!
reviews.text: We bought a 7 day Subway ticket and it was the best and fastest way to get around - just get to know your uptown from your downtown. Hilights for us were the Abysinnian Church in Harlem for Sunday service (get there early to line up and dress warmly), Brooklyn Bridge, Carnegie Hall tour, Grand Central Terminal, Central Park, Metropolitan Museum and the archetecture in Soho. Enjoy!

reviews.title: Excellent Value
reviews.text: The Belvedere is a magnificent establishment. The rate was lower than most other hotels that I searched before I booked the Belvedere, and I was a bit worried that an inexpensive hotel meant 1) poor security, 2) run-down and dirty, and 3) careless service. Wrong! I was blown away with check-in speed, the immaculate accomodations, the mini kitchen, and the overall FEEL of the place-- I felt safe and sound. (As a mother travelling alone with a six-year-old, safety unfortunately is a concern.)

The king bed was comfortable, the bathroom sparkling, and even the hotel binder on the desk was bonus! The user pictures here are a fair representation of what the Belvedere looks like. We stayed on the 16th floor so the view at dusk was breathtaking. Book the Belvedere and be at ease about it. It may be the only mid-budget hotel that I'll ever stay in while visiting NYC.
reviews.title: Excellent Experience for 2 New Orleanians
Hello from Denmark.
reviews.text: My husband, teenage daugher and I stayed four nights at the Belvedere in early October. We mainly chose it for the value and location. Finding a hotel room with a microwave and refrig was great. There was a small grocery store nearby so we stocked up on bottled water, fruit and breakfast-friendly snacks. Location was pretty good -- I was not at all concerned for my daughter and I to go out walking alone. Subway entrances were close enough; Time Square and the Theaters were within walking distance. Fifth Avenue, Rockefeller Center and plenty of shooping were within walking distance. We only took a taxi once our entire trip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booking a hotel in New York is not an easy business. They seem to be over priced and over hyped. Just before I began to pull my hair out I was recomended this hotel by a friend who is cabin crew with our national airline. She told me that they would stay there if they were paying for their own stay ( say for a shopping expedition). So on her advise I checked out the website and booked a room that worked out at just under 600 euro for 3 nights. We ended up in an executive room with THE most comfortable bed myself or my partner have ever slept in (it was 6ft sealy). The location was excellent (our room faced onto the original Fame school) with Times Square 2 blocks over and 9th ave having some nice inexpensive restaurants right beside us. The staff were lovely and the room was quite. Hopefully I'll be back in New York in the not so distant future and if so, I'd be overjoyed to stay there again.
reviews.title: Hooray

reviews.text: When we booked our hotel through hotels.com it was the best priced for the location and the amneities. Upon arrival at the belvedere the doorman david greeted us verywell. The check desk was very nice and they found us a room at 10.00am and the check in time 4.00 pm. When we got up to the 7 floor we got in our room it was nice and the entrence way had nice tile.The beds were very low and to soft the room was a little out dated but very very clean. The bathroom was nice and clean. The amenites were nice workout room breakfeast etc.etc.... The problums we had were 2 elavaters for a 17 storie buildingand they were very small. This place was a little pricy but very convienynt. The consiare was helpful (when there). So if you are looking for a good location and clean rooms.STAY HERE
reviews.title: Clean but outdated rooms

likes.liked: — cleanness of room and nice staff

reviews.text: Recently enjoyed a three night stay in the Belvedere and both my wife and I agree that it was very good mid price option in a great location.
reviews.title: Go for an executive room
The Belvedere is AWESOME AWESOME AWESOME!!
reviews.text: We arrived at 2pm and were told that our room would not be available until 4pm, a bit of an annoyance as we had planned to shower and change before going out for food, but not the end of the world. When we returned our room was ready and our first impression was that we had done well for the price paid. I had heard that there were ongoing refurbishments taking place and that the rooms on the higher floors were nicer so I spent the extra few $ on an executive room and was pleased with my choice. As mentioned by others the fridge and kitchenette area is very convenient and allows guests to bring in their own snacks and drinks at a much more reasonable price than the average hotel minibar. The bathroom was very nice and the decor and furnishings in general were more than what could usually be expected from a three star hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In contrast to some previous postings we had no problems with street noise or air con and although the two elevators are inadequate for the number of guests, it only took up an extra minute or two of our time each day.
reviews.title: Great experience--would definitely stay again!

likes.disliked: — Slow elevators and the business center internet was NOT free!

reviews.text: I stayed at The Belvedere for one Saturday night. Since it was a last minute trip, I had trouble finding a hotel with rooms available. The Belvedere was available and I paid nearly $600 for an Executive Room on the 15th floor. It was a newly remodeled room and was nice, When the elevator would stop on other floors, they looked dated, The 15th floor was nicer. Everything was fine. Nothing terrible, nothing spectacular. The location is good for most of the popular things that people do in Manhattan. Although I will probably try a different hotel the next time I am in NYC, I would not have any problem staying here again.
reviews.title: Would consider staying here again

reviews.text: Thanks to the previous recommendations of this excellent website we have just returned from a very enjoyable stay at the Belvedere. We were warmly welcomed by the reception staff and delighted with our large double double room on the 12th floor. The hotel was spotless and as we had booked directly with the hotel an excellent breakfast was included in the price. The hotel is located on a relatively quiet street within five mins walk of Times Square and close to the subway which we mastered with no problems at all and we felt safe at all times. I visited the following attractions etc based on information trailed from the New York forum section and would like to recommend the following ;
reviews.title: no hesitation in recommending the Belvedere

likes.liked: — the location cleanliness and the friendly staff
likes.disliked: — the beds were a little too firm but we were so tired we didn't notice after the first night!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The New York Party Shuffle bus tour.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: Use of [--] for discount printouts for theatre tickets.
reviews.title: WOULD GO BACK IN A HEART BEAT

reviews.text: Hurleys restaurant .(go out front door turn left ,cross to the Pigalle walk straight on and it is on the RHS.) Very reasonable and excellent food.
reviews.title: two thumbs up!

likes.liked: — Proximity to Times Sqaure and Broadway theatres

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Close to Broadway shows. Walked to Central Park. Great restaurants in Hell's Kitchen. Double decker bus at night. The room was OK, but you're in NY, go out and explore. Neighborhood was great.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: first trip to manhattan for my wife and i and the belvedere turned out to be a great choice. we booked the "ny1 special" which included breakfast (fabulous, by the way). nice room, but the staff made our trip extraordinary. the weather was rainy and the desk clerk loaned us an umbrella. when i asked about a jazz club, the concierge reccommended "birdland" and made the reservations (just a few blocks away and a wonderful evening). everyone talks about the location...we never used a cab or the subway during our entire stay. we will definitely use the belvedere again.
reviews.title: we were very impressed

likes.disliked: — had to pay for wireless internet

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: Just returned from a week at the Belvedere Hotel New York City. I had checked Trip Advisor when chosing the hotel and most of the reviews were good so we made our booking. The hotel is in an excellent location just 2 blocks from Times Square and one block to subway stations and a short walk up to Central Park. It was very quiet at night though quite warm in the room and we needed to have the air conditioning on all night. We had a room on the 10th floor which was very clean and comfortable with small kitchen area. Staff were very efficient and quickly attended to any small problems we had. The porters gave excellent local advice as to where to eat etc and were friendly with our children who were very impressed with getting our bags taken out of the taxi and put on a gold trolley and taken up to our room! Its not often I am completely happy with a hotel but this is definitely one I would return to and recommend to others.

reviews.title: A good choice of hotel!!
reviews.text: We stayed at The Belvedere in March and were a bit worried because of the mixed reviews but it was a lot better than we expected. Initially we were on the 5th floor and because we were at the back of the hotel it was really quiet at night. When a High School Group checked in they were quite noisy so we asked to move and we were put on the 12th floor. The room was fine with nice comfy beds and a decent bathroom.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the staff were really friendly and helpful, particularly Chris the Concierge who had lots of local knowledge.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from NYC, and The Belvedere was the perfect place to stay. Enough can't be said about the location. So close to Times Square and Broadway shows. But the neighborhood the hotel is located is very quite. Also, Gray Line tours is right around the corner and subway is about 3 blocks. With that said the hotel staff was very heplful and courteous. We were able to get last minute show tickets with the help of the conciere. Thanks. The staff did everything they could do to make our stay enjoyable. Next, on arrival we were told they did not have the king size bed that was reserved. But, if it would be alright we would be upgraded to a newly renovated room. This room was decorated and furnished very elegantly. Even though the room was somewhat small in a European style. It was very comfortable. And the bed was so comfortable it was a pleasure to crawl into after a day of shopping and sight seeing. Finally, we booked the NYC 1 rate. This included the breakfast buffet. This buffet was top notch food no contenental breakfast here.
reviews.title: Great stay!!!!!!

likes.disliked: — The house cleaning staff started work too early

reviews.title: Location, location, location
reviews.text: If you want to be near Time Square and Broadway, the location cannot be beat. Room was clean, furnishings up-to-date and the bed very comfortable. Nothing fancy -- but well appointed. Noise from hallway and street was average (our room faced 48th Street) -- not bad considering it is New York city.
Grab a drink at the Mont Blanc restaurant next door (take a left out of the hotel) -- a Swiss restaurant that will make you feel like you're in Europe.
reviews.title: Good stay at The Belvedere

likes.liked: — clean, reasonably sized bedroom. Excellent staff

reviews.title: Okay hotel but definitely has some quirks!
reviews.text: Stayed at The Belvedere between 11 & 17 October. The room was clean, comfortable & larger than we expected. The bathrooms were small though & had some inconveniences which I have reported to the hotel. We had breakfast in the hotel on several days & found it good. Plenty of places to eat to suit all tastes, & in all price ranges, in the area. The real strength of this hotel is the staff who were unfailingly cheerful, helpful, polite & welcoming. Any problems we had were dealt with without delay ie our TV did not work because someone (not us) had removed the batteries from the remote. We had no problem with the lifts. As other people have mentioned, don't miss the Top of the Rock

reviews.title: Great place to stay
reviews.text: This hotel is okay for the price. It was one of the most reasonably priced hotels I could find in Manhattan but it definitely has some quirks. When we checked in they only had one king-bedded rooms left so the couple we were traveling with settled for 2 doubles. Their room was on the 5th floor and the hallway smelled horrible. Luckily they didn't notice the smell in their room. When they got to their door the swipe keys wouldn't work so they had to go back to the front desk to get them reset. Instead of apologizing, they said "Well they should have worked!" The second day they asked to be moved to a king room so they were moved to the 17th floor. Again their keys didn't work. We were on the 16th floor - our room was nice enough but had an odd layout. There was a long hallway upon entering the room. The bathroom was tiny - the toilet was literally 2 inches from the wall. That was great advice that someone gave about using the service elevators at the end of the hall - they were so much faster. I noticed that when the elevator stopped on the 15th floor, it looked like that floor had been recently remodeled. It had dark wood doors and more updated carpet but I didn't get to see a room. We heard that there might be a taxi strike the day we left so we asked the concierge to book a limo to take us to the airport. It was half an hour late! We were so nervous about making our flight but i guess that wasn't the hotel's fault. One evening the bellman recommended a nearby restaurant - Tremonti's and it was the best pizza I've ever had! Overall our hotel experience wasn't bad but wasn't really great either. My two favorite things we did on this trip to NY were the new observation deck on top of Rockefellar Center (we bought tickets at about 5:30 so we'd be at the top for sunset - it was incredible and much nicer than the top of the Empire State Bldg) and the other thing was sitting at the outdoor bar at The Boathouse in Central Park (it was a gorgeous day and we had a blast there).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor felt this hotel met our demands. Not up to the Westin standard of course but no problems booking, and got breakfast each day which kept us well sustained - the NY1 deal. We had two double beds on the 12th floor and although I was expecting a lot of street noise there was none. The room was the average hotel size, very comfortable beds, plus fridge and coffee maker. We walked easily to the theatre, Times Square and the HoHo bus just around the corner. We had a lift just by our door so very convenient. The concierge was very helpful and booked our tours. Comparing prices of other hotels it was good value for money and would recommend it.
reviews.title: Everything you need

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well im absoluty gutted, just got back from the New York after staying at this hotel. Well the room was big but beds were so noisy when you moved on them. The noise from out side so so loud woke us up many a time in a night. As for the checking in. What they don't mention is they put a hold of $300 on your credit card untill you check out. This is NOT explained on check in and on their website. I needed this money on my card and they would not release the funds. I asked them what shall i do for money and i quote one of the managers comments " can you play music? as you could busk"!!!!! No customer service when asked about changing room was told you got a good rate so thats why you got an older room. Do not stay at this hotel. The location is worth one * alone.
reviews.title: Only stay here for the location

reviews.text: After spending 4 nights in Boston, we arrived here for another 4 nights. Really lovely entrance hall, very friendly staff and great room. Room could do with a refurbishment but it was clean and comfortable. The kitchen area was good but maybe some plates and cutlery could be added. That said if we go back to NY we will stay here again. It is in an ideal position and it was great to go to the theatre and be able to walk to hotel. We found a great deli and a pub close by so we were happy! Great hotel- would recommend it.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in NYC!

likes.liked: — Comfort of room and we got breakfast!
likes.disliked: — The lifts take ages - are creaky and need fixing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As frequent visitors to NYC, we were very happy with the Belvedere Hotel. The room was very clean and the largest we've ever had in the theater district! The location was great, one block from Broadway (and the TKTS booth) in a very safe area. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our rate included breakfast which was a complete buffet. We will definitely book this hotel for our future visits. As an added bonus, the Swiss restaurant next door had very good food at reasonable prices (for NYC).
reviews.title: Good hotel and great location

reviews.text: Our September, 2008 stay was truly one of the worst hotel experiences in recent memory. Please note that the website photos do not match the actual rooms you will be receiving when you check in, unless you have asked for a "completely renovated room" which will cost substantially more than the advertised prices. The room you will receive, as did my wife and I, and all of the other convention participants who booked here with us, will be classified as a "partially renovated" room by the staff. This means that it will be dirty, with stained carpeting in need of stretching ( a definite tripping hazard), peeling wallpaper, mildew and mold on almost all bathroom surfaces, no view (ours was of a tenement building across the alley), and the overwhelming pungent smell of industrial strength room freshener which will permeate all of your clothes and your luggage. When we were there we attempted to complain about our room, but the staff, who was obviously used to dissatisfied customers, refused to re-assign a different room to us, and did not even come upstairs to inspect the room after we made our complaints known. The front desk manager, Julio, was the rudest manager we have ever encountered, unwilling to act on any of our complaints or the multiple complaints of other guests with similar problems. The other front desk staff quietly apologized to us when Julio abruptly removed himself from the situation to take an "important phone call"--the front desk staff seemed overwhelmed with the continous stream of complaining guests. The bathroom was the smallest bathroom I have ever seen in a hotel in the United States. The room furniture was broken, scratched and looked as if it were purchased from the Salvation Army resale shop. The air conditioners were small dirty units which did not operate properly unless you tied back the rubberized curtain to enable airflow. The vents of the air conditioner were filthy, with dirt and dust overflowing the filter area onto the front control panel. The "kitchenette" featured prominently on their website was nothing more than a corner of a long, dark hallway with a dirty dormitory refrigerator and a cheap microwave oven perched on a flimsy countertop. The elevators were not functioning for half of our four day stay, forcing us to share the service elevator with the staff; we were stuck in one of the elevator for several minutes when it suddenly stopped. If you are able to change your reservations and stay elsewhere, definitely do! There are several better hotels immediately surrounding this one, including a Courtyard Inn, a Marriott, a Westin, etc. I am sure that they have higher standards for their operations and take their responsibilities with respect to customer satisfaction seriously.
reviews.title: Beware of the Belvedere!

likes.disliked: — The rude front office staff, particularly Julio

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here in mid April 2008 following recommendation by friends. We are frequent visitors to New York usually staying on 6th Avenue.
reviews.title: Loved the room but nothing else !

reviews.text: The room was beautiful with lovely furniture and small kitchenette area which included fridge and microwave. However the bathroom was absolutely tiny and corridoors quite grubby
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: Staff were friendly though.
reviews.title: Good all-rounder

reviews.text: Location wise, its at least a 10 -15 minute walk to 5th and 6th Avenue though you have to pass through some pretty dirty/smelly streets. I wouldn't like to do this when it is dark.The fire station is just down the street so its pretty noisy at night !!
reviews.title: Convenient hotel for Times Square

likes.disliked: — There was nothing we didn't like

reviews.text: The buffet breakfast was the worst hotel breakfast I have ever had and was average price for a hotel. orange juice came out of a machine and tasted like it was made from powder and water. Coffee was disgusting.
reviews.title: We love The Belvedere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel twice previously. Check in was quick and easy. We had a double double room on the 11th floor. Our room was front facing and was quite a bit louder than the rooms ive had previously which were both backwards facing. The school opposite the hotel created quite a bit of noise, however not unbearable noise.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: This room was definately dated, the safe was broken and i could only open it by sticking my little finger into a small hole and dragging the door open. The radiator leaked and made the carpet a little damp. These were both bearable problems and didnt bother me, but did bother my partner slightly.
reviews.title: "great hotel and location!
not very good
reviews.text: On our second morning the toilet blocked so we went down to the reception to make them aware of the problems, the lady was very helpful and explained she didnt have a double double available until that evening so we could pack out stuff and put it in storage and then check into the new room later that day. When we explained we didnt need a double double and had only booked one as it had been cheaper on the internet than a king size, she gave us a king room on the 14th floor straight away.

We promptly went and threw our belongings in our suitcases and moved rooms. The second room was excellent, the best bed i have ever slept in (i looked forward to going to bed just so i could lay in it) the room was still the same size and was backwards facing so the noise was reduced. We had no further problems and really enjoyed the central location of this hotel.
reviews.title: Belvedere Badly Needs a New Heating System

reviews.text: The staff were all friendly and helpful, conceige booked us a town car for our return to the airport. We were very pleased and would not hesitate staying here again.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great location, good price for NYC
Great location. Very good value for money in New York.
reviews.text: My partner and I spent 7 days in total at this hotel this month, (Oct 2007), and were very pleased with value and service.Location is excellent; central but no noise disturbance at night.

reviews.title: Great Location, Comfortable Hotel
reviews.text: We stayed 5 nights in an executive room; ( this was an upgrade we were given free on arrival). The room was very spacious-6ft bed and loads of space around it. The room also has a fridge, a microwave and a coffee maker.Clean and newly decorated; it was a really comfortable and welcoming place to stay.

reviews.title: Loved it!
reviews.text: Staff all very pleasant and helpful.

reviews.title: a few quirks
reviews.text: We had breakfast one morning and there was plenty of choice from the buffet. However, unless you book a bed and breakfast deal there's no point in being pinned down to the hotel for breakfast as there is such a vaste choice in the streets all around the hotel.

reviews.title: Very Good Experience
reviews.text: There is no night bar to sit and chill out in but there is a fantastic little restaurant/bar just a few yards away, (the Mont Blanc); we ate there a few times and we used to stop off for last drink(s) on the way home. There is a lovely walled garden at the back which has a intimate and relaxed ambience. The owner and staff at this restaurant are really friendly and the food and wine were good too!

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: Stayed in the Belvdere from 22nd October to 28th October inclusive. Like most people I booked it based on the reviews on trip advisor. It was fantastic. The rooms are lovely and very comfortable (personally I liked the firm bed!). Yes the bathroom is smallish but what do you want to do in it!!. The coffee maker and microwave were a real bonus. It is lovely to be able to have a nice cup of coffee either in the morning or when you come back in the evening. We were always left two or three sachets of coffee. Despite intending to make use of microwave due to the enormous variety of eateries in the locality we didn't!! The staff are efficient and helpful. I changed a travellers cheque every morning no problem (I think we were there at a very good time of the year. The hotel was busy but not overly so). We had no problem with the lifts but as we were only on the eight floor we used the stairs when going out and the lift when we came in. The hairdryer wasn't working and within five minutes of a phonecall to reception a new one was delivered. The location of this hotel is superb with Times Square only a couple of blocks away and theatres and restaurants within walking distance. We went to see The Phantom of the Opera which was marvellous. We got the tickets at the ticket booth in Times Square for 50 dollars each. It's worth going to for the special effects alone. Use the subway. It's the only way to get around. It is 2 dollars for any journey and there are different tickets you can get for a certain amount of days. We got a weekly ticket that costs twenty one dollars (per person) and used it all the time. If you are going to be there on a Sunday try and fit in a trip to Harlem. There are many you can book and it is a great experience. We spent a full day in Central Park and it is really lovely to walk around it. It's an oasis in the middle of the city. A visit to the Metropolitan Museum is another good day out but it can be very busy and it's not easy to get a coffee or whatever in it so be sure to bring water with you. The area around Pier 17 is very nice with lovely shops and restaurants. It is also close to Battery Park where the ferries to Liberty and Ellis Island leave from. We spent another day there and it was a wonderful experience. Anyway, back to the hotel. I can highly recommend it and it is excellent value for money. You couldn't be any closer to Times Square, Broadway etc. Yes there can be noise at night from the fire station at the top of the road but who does'nt hear noise from fire engines and police cars at night if they live in any city? When in New York go with the flow. The pace of life is mad and everyone seems to be running around the place but you'll be on your holidays and don't have to run with them! Try and let people know that you are on holidays. There are so many different nationalities living in New York the people in shops, restaurants and bars do not know automatically that you're a tourist. We generally found most people very friendly - talk to them and they'll talk back to you. New York is full of people looking at maps and it's the same on the subway. We found that on a number of occasions strangers stopped and asked if they could help us and this also happened on the subway. Don't be nervous just go and enjoy!!

We stayed for 3 nights with our 1 yr old baby. 5* for value for money. Very clean and quiet room with an amazing view from the 16th floor! Room was very clean and staff all very helpful. The kitchinette was very useful for the baby and there were several convenience stores close by for milk etc. Breakfast was good and the baby eats for free!
reviews.title: Excellent stay
The Belvedere - A great choice for NYC
reviews.text: Location location location with this hotel. We would definately stay again and have been telling our friends!

reviews.title: Belvedere Hotel
reviews.text: My husband and I were recently in NYC (1st time) and stayed 5 nights at the Belvedere Hotel. We do a fair bit of travelling and are accustomed to staying in nice hotels. The service at the Belvedere was great, location could not be better and we would definately stay again and recommend it to family/friends. We found the hotel room to be clean and spacious and the staff friendly and willing to answer any questions we had. The price of this hotel was more than fair for the Times Square area and to us, location is important. This hotel has both going for it.
J & P
reviews.title: location !!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: We were meeting relatives from Ireland in New York in late July and we all stayed at the Belvedere Hotel. The hotel was within walking distance to Broadway and restaurant row and we were lucky enough to be there during restaurant week! The room was nice with 2 double beds and the beds were comfortable. The room has window AC units which were hard to keep regulated at times. The hallways were not air conditioned but we weren't in the hallways that much. We had children with us and it was hard to get on the elevator with the stroller as the elevator was usually full by the time it got to our floor so we ended up taking the service elevator at the end of the hall. Hotel staff were delightful. We didn't have problems with the hairdryers blow power but the other room did.
reviews.title: Loved the Belvedere

likes.disliked: — Elevator was slow and and always full - hard to get the stroller on

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in time is 4pm so if you get there before that you cannot get into your room and will have to wait around the lobby or they will store your luggage and you can go out and do something in the city.
reviews.title: Very nice room, concierge worthless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room had a kitchen, fridge, microwave, sink and cabinets so we could bring leftovers back and put in our fridge. The hotel cafe has a delicious breakfast buffet but it is $20.
reviews.title: Sleepless in New York

reviews.text: The gift shop is nice too for snacks and tshirts.
reviews.title: Mixed stay at the Belvedere

reviews.text: I would definitely stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The exceptional location of The Belvedere Hotel is what makes it special. Anything you want to access in Manhattan is easy because of mid-town location. Room was clean, air conditioned, good bed, super rate, and liked having the safe. Front desk staff were friendly and attentive to our needs. All three concierges were most helpful and insightful when we asked about things to do. Can't wait to stay at the Belvedere again. For discounted Broadway tickets, head to lower Manhattan, South Street Seaport booth on Front street. Be there an hour before they open. You won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: Two thumbs up for The Belvedere!

reviews.text: We had two days here with our 2 teenagers and
reviews.title: Pure qualit and good location

reviews.text: I am always concerned about getting 3 star hotels wrong in large cities as they can be mixed in quality and cleanliness, however we were not dissappointed the Belvedere, it was very clean and comforatable ,the staff were friendly and the location was great. I couldnt fault anything about it and would not hesitate to recommend it.
reviews.title: location the best part

reviews.text: The Mexican restuarant nearby whilst looking authentic was just average but handy for the hotel, I wouldnt ttherefore rush back.
reviews.title: slow speed internet connection....

reviews.text: Having stayed at new york a few times in the past and I know how easy it is to get either the location or indeed the hotel wrong and have in the past taken no chances and paid over the odds for a 4 star chain hotel to ensure it is ok, such as a Marriott. This hotel however is a good value option for a tourist for people not wanting to spend a fortune.
reviews.title: It's an OK place

reviews.text: This is the 3rd time we have stayed at the Belvedere in NYC since we do 2 trade shows a year in New York. We used to love it, but it's just not up to our standards anymore. Our previous stays were pretty good but we had numerous problems this time.
reviews.title: It used to be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, we reserved a Queen bed over 2 months in advance and weren't able to get it, so we took 2 doubles for our 4 night stay.
reviews.title: Very satisfied

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we got was also in need of repair. The bathtub drain was disgusting and the metal covering had been removed for some reason. The bathroom sink was also leaking water onto the floor so we had to place a towel there so that the whole bathroom floor wouldn't be wet.
reviews.title: A real gem

likes.disliked: — Bathroom could have been a bit newer, but was ok

reviews.text: It also got chilly during our stay and we found out that the room didn't have its own heater, only an ac. Room service had to bring up a portable heater for us to use during our stay.
reviews.title: Belvedere is really good!

reviews.text: Another thing that bothered me was that the bell boys had frowns on their faces the whole time and just looked like they didn't want to be there.
reviews.title: Spendid stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was amazing. The Decor was really modern and nice, The hotel was clean and beds were confortable. The staff very helpful, they directed us on how to save hundreds on show tickets, where most hotels would only offer you there services, stadd multiple times showed us the best options which were outside the hotels services. We had a end corner room which had an elevator next to it, felt like we had our own private elevator (only once in 4 day was another person in it).
reviews.title: Excellent Expereince - Great Service

likes.liked: — The level of Perfection for keeping it clear and amazing service

reviews.text: This hotel was a real find and I would definitely go back there again. It's only a few blocks from Times Square and is above average compared with other hotels of a similar type. We arrived early and our rooms were not ready. The front desk was very helpful and stored our bags until our rooms were ready. This allowed us to go out & explore NYC. When we returned all the paperwork was ready and check-in and bag return was very speedy.
reviews.title: Good value close to Times Square

reviews.text: Stayed for one night for a Broadway show. Booked directly from the hotel's site after comparing rates with other travel sites.
reviews.title: Great location, excellent staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Loved It!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: * Excellent staff - we arrived at 2pm and were able to check in (regular check in time is 4pm). Very courteous, always with smiles, and pleasant
reviews.title: Great Value & Location

reviews.text: Great staff are not just found they are developed and this hotel has great staff. Rooms are good but beds are really hard. If I had one suggestion it would be to offer some rooms with foam beds or sleep number beds.
reviews.title: Great place, Great Staff
great location
reviews.text: Just back from five nights in the Belvedere and felt the need to write in support of the hotel. Location cannot be faulted, short walk to the subway, Times Square and the theatres on Broadway. Our room had a kingsize bed and was on the 14th floor it faced the back of the hotel, it was extremely quiet and the view was good. The room was very spacious and much larger than I thought it would be having read some previous reviews. It was also in good decorative order. Yes the bathroom was quite small, but just how much time do you spend in a bathroom when there's so much to see and do in New York. Housekeeping was excellent.
The price represented excellent value for money and this comes from someone who never books anywhere without first checking up on tripadvisor.
reviews.title: We'll be back

reviews.text: First time in NYC, but not the last. Fell in love with the city and its people. Glad to see the stereotype of rude New Yorkers is just a stereotype. We found everyone, everywhere, to be friendly and helpful. And felt safer than in our own small hometown.
reviews.title: Great Location and Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for The Belvedere, when we return to NYC, we'll be staying at the Belvedere unless it's booked up. Enjoyed our stay there - 4 nights in early January. Location was great, front office staff were great, price was great. Room was perfect for what we were expecting at that price. We can't afford Trump or the Hilton, so our expectations are based on that. And actually, The Belvedere exceeded those expectations. We were expecting smaller and drearier since NYC is supposed to be so expensive. But we found excellent value. We had a room facing the back, which was very quiet, although the hotel is on a not-so-busy street. They were doing some construction up the road though, which might have proved noisy for those in the front.
reviews.title: Perfect for a theater/dining blitz

reviews.text: Fantastic location very central near Times Square, Theatres & Subway stations. The staff were very friendly and helpful especially when we had to stay for longer due to the bad weather/snow. The room was very clean and comfortable with a fridge and microwave. The lobby lifts were a bit slow so we used the one at the end of the corridor. The occasional building work was our only niggle as it was quite loud. We had an great time in New York dispite the weather and would highly recommend the Belvedere to our friends.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location

likes.liked: — The central location of the hotel and helpful friendly staff

reviews.title: Nice desk people! Room variable
reviews.text: We booked two rooms three people each, ended up over $1200. which I thought was steep. No free breakfast or discounts because it was a school holiday week. The desk people are very nice! Door man too. Rooms big for new york, little worn and seedy . Problem with the shower was very frustrating. Couldn't stabilize water, so the water was mostly freezing, then boiling for a second--old worn out shower head didn't help. Asked daily for repairs--nothing happened. Paid extra for three people, but got only 2 washcloths, one little shampoo, two mugs, so we felt a little burned for $1200 bucks 2 nights.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great, the elevators fast, if I got a deal like other people did at this hotel I would go back!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

likes.disliked: — The lift was a bit slow

reviews.title: The Best Location and Great Staff.
reviews.text: I spent a week in this hotel from 7th - 14th February 2007.

The hotel location is perfect for anyone who wants to visit Manhatten. The hotel is just 2 minutes walk from Times Square and just around the corner from the Gray Line Tourist Centre. The hotel is surrounded by shops, restaurants, bars, etc and everything you need can be found practically outside the hotel door.
reviews.title: You Must Stay Here!

reviews.text: I notified the hotel ahead of time that I would be arriving late at night from a flight and they said no problem, your room will be waiting for you. I even called them again when I got into NYC to remind them I would be coming in late. When I arrived at the hotel at 1 am they told me there was a "plumbing problem" in my room and they didn't have another room to place me in. They told me they went ahead and reserved me a room at a different hotel down the street--when I got there it was a horrible zero star motel that I couldn't even take my shoes off in because it was so dirty! I was very dissappointed in the Belvedere and would never recommend staying there.
reviews.title: I never got my room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the time we arrived the staff were very pleasant and couldnot do enough for you. We would reccomend a stay here. Right next to Times Square and a bus stop 50 metres away. Book in advance directly with the hotel to get one of the Special Offers to include breakfast. The breakfast alone will keep you going throughout the day and they encourage you to wrap up some cold meat for a snack later.
reviews.title: Could not be more central

reviews.text: I'm not sure how we actually came to find the Belvedere...my sister and I were planning our trip to nyc and probably just googled something or other, found Tripadvisor.com and the Belvedere from there. It had great reviews/ratings, seemed like a fair price for Manhattan and was near to our theatre.
reviews.title: a wonderful little place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very pleased with the hotel. We arrived early (before check-in time of 4:00) and had no problem in storing our bags with the bellman while we went out into the stormy/windy afternoon to explore the city. We, btw, had forgotten to pack umbrellas and were able to purchase them at the hotel giftshop which we found to be wellstocked and reasonably priced. We had a newly renovated double, double on the 14th floor I think, facing the street in front and found it to be very quiet. The rooms were a good size, included a kitchenette and were clean and maintained daily in a timely manner...just to show the quick service a bit, we noticed the drain in the tub was a bit slow/clogged our first morning and left a note, asking if they could please check into it for us. It was taken care of by our return to the hotel that evening. All of the hotel staff was very friendly and we really had no problem at all with the elevators or timing of them...the hotel was busy and bustling, but we waited a minute or two at most. I used the basement laundry one day and found it to very clean/bright with up-to-date appliances as well as snack/beverage machines if you were going to be down there for awhile.
reviews.title: Comfortable and well situated

reviews.text: The hotel was well situated for everything we were doing...we were there the week and didn't take a single nycity cab. Granted, we did put alot of miles on our feet {the best way to get a real feel for the city} and utilized the subway & hop on/off (red ) buses a couple of days as well.
reviews.title: Satisfied

reviews.text: My wife and I, along with our three kids (two teenagers and a 10 year old) spent 4 nights at the Belvedere in August. I booked the room on Placestostay.com and got a pretty good rate ($225). I was worried about having 5 in one room but we didn't get hassled about it. The other reviews of this hotel are spot on. The location cannot be beat! Literally two blocks from time square, about 4 blocks from most of the theatres and about 10 blocks from Central Park. We didn't take one cab ride. A good guide to NYC city blocks is that 20 blocks equal one mile no matter where you are in the city. About the hotel: spacious clean room with refregerator, Friendly front desk staff, good maid service, nice gift shop, helpful concierge. The hotel is on a quiet side street and it is amazing that Time Square is so close. There is a French Restaurant and a Mexican restaurant right down the street. Down two blocks and up one is the Olympia restaurant which is great for breakfast. The only negative is slow elevators but they have three available.
reviews.title: Great Location and Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We returned today from a few days in New York. We stayed at The Belvedere Hotel and it was a joy to stay there.
reviews.title: It was a joy ...

likes.disliked: — Only 2 elevators and that's not enough for 17 floors

reviews.text: We had a normal room with a King-bed.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotelstaff was pleasant, very helpfull and polite. The room was clean, big enough and looked newly decorated (you only need a place to sleep but a nice room is a pleasure to stay in). The address of the hotel is located near Broadway and you can walk to and from several sites in New York.
reviews.title: We loved it.

likes.liked: — Everything...especially the huge bed and view

reviews.text: Negative points:
reviews.title: Great hotel and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have just returned from a week long stay at the belvedere and just had to sit down and write about it..As you will see from the other reviews you already know its a great location,1block from times sqaure,the gray line sightseeing station and pretty much right in the heart of the city.What most dont say it just how courteous and professional the staff are there.I have stayed in numerous NY hotels over the years but from now i on i shall only book this hotel and if its full i shall wait until there's a vacancy! The rooms were spacious especially compared to NY standards,extremely comfortable,great facilities,great bathroom with great showers and overall a joy to stay in.The hotel itself once again i could not fault and even though previous reviews complain about the slowness of the lifts we did not find this a problem during our entire stay with the exception of lunchtime when the majority of guests check out and this is obviously going to cause delays in any hotel..If your unsure of were to stay in New York and you are scouring website after website looking for hotels and are unsure,book this one and you will not be disappointed.Oh an most of all enjoy New York,the best city in the world!!
reviews.title: Only hotel in NY you need to look at!!

reviews.text: I took my teenage daughter to nyc for a visit, and was a bit concerned about safety, but this is the place to stay if you want a hotel within walking distance of theatres, restaurants and shopping. It's just a few minutes from Broadway, and if you plan on using the hop on/off bus, you can purchase tickets around the corner at gray line, very convenient. I felt very comfortable in this area and really had no safety concerns. The Belvedere is a lovely hotel with a great staff, very efficient and friendly. I would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Wonderful location

reviews.text: We loved the Belvedere! The rooms were very clean and the hotel itself was in excellent condition. The location was perfect, with trains just two blocks away. Stay away from the Mexican restaurant on the corner and the breakfast place across the street from it. They were both tourist traps with terrible food. Ask the staff at the Belvedere for recommendations - they never sent us to a bad place. We look forward to returning to the Belvedere.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable, great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After having read some reviews on this website we decided to book this hotel and we are very happy for having done it. The location is very good because it's near Time Square and therefore the turistic area and it's near the subway so we were able to reach other parts of Manhatten reasonably quickly. The rooms are spacious, clean and quiet. The reception was very professional maybe not very smiling however helpful. Would certainly go back there.
reviews.title: Nice location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was desperately looking for a hotel since our favorite, the Michaelangelo was very pricey, but still wanting the same amenities. Found this, and decided to give it a try. What a great find. It is nice, clean and newly redone. We took a red eye there and were beyond exhausted when we arrived at 7am. Got a great recommendation for breakfast and when we returned at 9:30, waited for less than an hour for our room to be ready. It was a large room, with microwave, coffee, and fridge. Utilized the fridge for water. Great location, only two blocks to subway and walking distance to most everything. Staff were always helpful. Noticed that quite a few people did have their dogs staying with them. It is a great location, great hotel, great price.
reviews.title: great little gem

likes.disliked: — the bed was a little hard, but did not hinder any sleeping

reviews.title: Great hotel great value
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at the Belvedere in mid July. The staff was always friendly and accomodating. The rooms include a microwave and coffe maker. They are small but not overly so. The bed was comfortable, the window unit AC worked great and provided white noise. The hotel is located on a quiet street just off the theater district, about a 5 minute walk from times square and within a block of the major subway lines. The area felt safe at all hours as well. In my opinion, you cannot beat the location/price combination.

Positives: I had an overall pleasant experience at this hotel. The staff were all very friendly and accomodating. The room was clean and a decent size for a hotel located in midtown Manhattan. Another plus was that the room contained a minifridge and other amenities.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Negatives: Wireless was $10 per day (which isn't really that bad), but I've received free wireless at other hotels. The elevator was very tight, and made me feel very claustrophobic. I had a problem coming down from my room on the 11th floor, as it stopped on almost nearly all floors below it and picked up a large amount of people to bring down to the main level.
reviews.title: A true gem!

reviews.text: Having never been to the Big A , I booked this hotel for a week for my wife and I to stay for a week. I crossed my fingers and wouldnt you know, it was fantastic.
reviews.title: Super!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Flat screen, Wireless ( 10.00 bucks a day), Laundromat ( in the basement) excellent and friendly staff.. but the best...it was QUIET! Where else in New York can you get quiet? I stayed in downtown San Diego and didnt get a wink because of all the traffic and noise,,,but here on West 48 it was quiet as a mouse...except they are putting up a new high rise on the corner so if you sleep past 9am you are gonna get crane and concrete truck noise.
reviews.title: Superb location! Great hotel!

likes.disliked: — Only two slow lifts and we were on the 17th floor

reviews.title: Great Value in Theater District
reviews.text: The location, price and staff are great, but the best things about the hotel are the fridge and microwave. Between our doggie bags and the Salad/Hot Bar at Food Emporium (one block north on Eighth), we saved enough money on food that we were able to see one more show from the good seats. Tip: There are no plates, utensils, etc., provided, so if you need them, bring them.

reviews.title: Great stay
reviews.text: If you want convenience, value, & above average accomodations, this is the place to stay. We stayed at the Belvedere from 10/12-10/17 & were very satisfied. Boasts a friendly staff, good sized rooms for NYC, & quiet surroundings.
The Belvedere is within easy walking distance of Times Square, Theater District, Restaurant Row, & Rockefeller Center.
reviews.title: Everything we Expected
Good location, poor hotel.
reviews.text: We have traveled extensively & can highly recommend the Belvedere. We will definitely stay there again.

reviews.title: Comfortable facility; great location
reviews.text: Stayed at the Belvedere 16-21 October. Hotel was everything that we expected from the positive reviews on this site. From check-in, which was late at night, to checking out could not find fault with the Hotel. No problem with the elevators, we were on the 14th floor. Walked down sometimes for the exercise which loosend us up for the day ahead. Very Short walk to Times Sq and Subway. Plenty of locations for eats. Will stay here again on our next visit.

Our family stayed there 5 days on the occasion of my 50th birthday - first stay in NY for 3 of the 5 of us. Excellent situation, clean & large rooms, good value for money (compared to usual NY rates ...), helpful concierge. Only (minor) drawback: slow / not enough elevators. We also had a great jazz evening & good food at the Birdland, and good dinner at the Vinyl with friendly service.
reviews.title: Great place to visit NY
Overall solid hotel with good staff
reviews.text: Shared a double-double with a friend a long weekend recently. Good location if you like staying near Times Square and the theatres as all are within an easy walk.
The front desk and concierge are great, contributing to the nice atmosphere in the lobby. Though the very slow lifts must be fixed!
reviews.title: Great Location; Helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself is relatively spacious and the bed comfortable - though I'd say there was just a bit too much unnecessary furniture in the room. The bathroom is the letdown though - yes, it is very small indeed but worse, I found it a tad old and not well laid out.
reviews.title: satisfied with the belvedere

reviews.text: We have stayed here twice in the past couple years and love the hotel. Its location is great...between 8th and 9th avenues on 48th street. It has a great corner grocery a 100 yards from the hotel and with a mini fridge, microwave, and coffee maker it was handy for purchasing various knick knacks to eat on. Staff is great...some mention slow elevators but if you will look to the end of the lobby or the end of your hall you will find a faster elevator that many are not aware of. Do not stay on the top floor...rooms are smaller than 14th floor. This is not a luxury hotel but is a very clean, convenient, safe place. Taxi ride from LaGuardia is $32 plus whatever your tip is.
reviews.title: Great Value Hotel

reviews.text: After reading all the reviews on trip advisor we decided to give this hotel a try. We were not disappointed. In fact, this hotel by far exceeded our expectations. What a great find. The staff here is second to none. Several of the bellman even remembered our name when we would enter and exit the hotel. We were always greeted with warm smiles. This hotel is located right in the middle of everything. The rooms were spotless and were of good size for New York city. We have stayed in New York several times and have paid twice as much for a hotel that did not even come close to the Belvedere. We will return to the Belvedere again.
reviews.title: Superb hotel at a great value!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a week at this hotel and were most impressed. The location is right in the middle of the theatre district, so we could walk to most places we wanted to visit. This hotel had friendly service, and most reasonable prices. I was a bit dubious when I booked because the prices were so reasonable $185/night on weekdays, $215 on weekends. The room was larger than I had expected. Very comfortable bed - nice marble bath. There was little traffic noise (we were on the 14th floor). I highly recommend this hotel and we will definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Loved the Belvedere!!

reviews.text: This is a true find in the city! Larger rooms than NYC usually offers, incredibly friendly and helpful staff, attention to your needs... quiet... the Belvedere has it all! You're in the Theater District and can easily walk to Rockefeller Center, great shopping, plenty of restaurants, and many attractions! The only drawback is the time you may wait for the elevators, but as you face the elevators, look to your right down the hallway. You'll see a service elevator that the staff welcomes you to use... it's much faster! Say hi to Luis, the bellman, for us!
reviews.title: One of the best values in the Big Apple!

reviews.text: We took Super Shuttle from JFK ( 38.00 for two people) however we took the subway and the Air Train back to JFK as by then I had figured out the subway and we got from hotel to our terminal in 50 min. When we arrived a week prior it took 2 hours for us to get to our hotel because you must call the super shuttle ( even if you have reserved it) and you must wait for it to come pick both you and others to drop them off at hotel. Never again will I take a super shuttle from jfk...I am a confirmed subway enthusiast now.
reviews.title: Little Gem in NYC

reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights after a lot of searching on the internet. Great location for Subway, Times Square, Shopping & felt safe at all times.
reviews.title: Excellent Location for a Great Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was large enough for 3 adults sharing. Good powerful shower.
reviews.title: The Belvedere is fab!!!

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel for those not wanting to spend a fortune on accommodation and save their money to shop!
reviews.title: Good for those on a budget!

likes.disliked: — There are only 2 lifts servicing every person on the hotels 16 floors.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only one problem a very annoying squeeky bed.
reviews.title: Belvedere Hotel NY. OK, but if I can choose, not a choice

reviews.text: Myself and my husband stayed at the Belvedere for 7 nights in September as part of our honeymoon. We both thought the hotel was wonderful. It was excellent value for money and we can't fault anything. The staff were polite and helpful, it was roasting when we were in New York and out air con unit broke down the one day and by the time we got back to the room later that afternoon, it had been fixed. The breakfasts were good value for money too, you had a choice of a full breakfast which was $16.00 ish and a continental for about $12.00, both of which were self serve and pretty much all you could eat. The only minor thing was that the lift kept breaking down, but there were 3 others to use and on some occasions we used the stairs as we were only on the 9th floor. The location was fab, a great deli on the corner with some lovely restaurants nearby. Times Sqaure was a five minute walk away, and one day we walked to Central Park, then to the Empire State Building and then back to the hotel, so if you aren't lazy and don't mind walking, the location is fab! I get the feeling that some people who have reviewed the Belvedere are just hard to please and are never going to be satisfied and are just plain picky!! And to be fair, you are in New York City - the hotel is somewhere to sleep, and thats it. We are already planning our next trip to New York and will definitely be staying there again, we loved it!!
reviews.title: Be sure and check your reservation a million times

likes.disliked: — the way we were treated at the front desk. It was like a ....ny moment...

reviews.title: great hotel
reviews.text: date of return 21 october 2005
Ireland
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: Hotel was great, location perfect,staff were great .We had no problems with this hotel.The staff from reception to the cleaning staff could not do enough for us.Room were great. bathrooms a bit small but clean but you don't need a big bathroom.It is in walking distance to everything.Go and see a show well worth while.I would stay in this hotel again
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.text: Never expected such a great hotel, for such a great price. the location is within walking distance to central park, and close to most of the main attractions. The staff on the desk are extremely helpful with advice on all you ask. The rooms are great, with a little kitchen area, but it's not required, the local deli's will deliver. You must try the brazilian restraunt behind the hotel
reviews.title: Belvedere is a real jewel
Absolutely Fabulous!
reviews.text: If you want to stay at a well priced hotel, in a lovely neighborhood near everything (Time Square, Theaters, Rockefeller Plaza, subways, etc)...stay at The Belvedere. Everyone was friendly, and the rooms were decent. They could use some updating, but they were clean. I loved the fridge (kept our Juniors cheesecake cold until the next day) and the microwave for quick snacks in between outings. The valet was extremely friendly, even walking us through a wall of people on a busy church Sunday to a cab waiting for us on the next block. We've already booked our room to return with our children next summer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is so brilliant, so close to everything, so clean, polite and knowlegable staff.
reviews.title: Fab!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The initial reaction to entering the standard king bed room is this place is old and small. The bathroom takes small to new levels. You can wash your hands while sitting on the toilet. We also had the same problem someone else mentioned about the hair dryer blowing a fuse. But they did have a second hair dryer placed in the closet and that one seemed to do okay. The front desk staff was pleasant, but wouldn't let us check in until 4:00 pm even though I'm sure when we arrived at 3:00 pm rooms were available. The concierge always has a line.
reviews.title: Makes you want to stay out longer!

reviews.text: The elevators are painfully slow and rather small. What is really frustraing is waiting forever and seeing a full elevator open, having to wait for the next. There is only one ice machine and one soda machine, each located on the second floor.
reviews.title: Attention Ladies

likes.disliked: — Power going out, slow elevators, bathroom, staff

reviews.text: The location is good. But you can do better for your money. Skip the Belvedere.
reviews.title: Excellent location

likes.liked: — close to attractions, subway nearby to get anywhere in New York

reviews.text: If you want to go to New York and have your heart set on staying at the Belvedere, don't go in the summer. After the power went out (twice) while blow drying my hair, I was instructed by the operator to not have the air conditioning on while blow drying my hair. Clearly this happens all the time. I'm sure they spend all day taking phone calls from women whose power has gone out.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

likes.liked: — The comfort, friendly staff and the convenience

reviews.text: Also, they have the 2 slowest elevators in all of New York City transporting their hundreds of guests (slowly) up to their rooms.
reviews.title: Not the greatest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would highly recommend it to any one going to New York City!
reviews.title: One Word - Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms good and spacious for all the shopping bags too!!
reviews.title: Will stay there everytime!

likes.disliked: — Elevators were a little small and slow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just become a member so thought I'd share past experiences with other travellers.
reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations!

reviews.text: Went to NYC for my 40th birthday in June 06, booked fairly last-minute, looked at hotels on the net and found the Belverdere, can only say this was ideal, room & hotel spotless, staff v. friendly, always willing to help, check-in was a breeze as was check-out, room cost $1100 for 4 nights in King Deluxe Room, it had a small kitchen area, bathroom, loads of storage, tv/playstation/internet access - ideally situated to see the city, would stay here everytime due to its location, staff, cost ................ well everything.
reviews.title: Location location

likes.disliked: — Arriving to find that our room had been given away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights in the Belvedere Hotel and was delighted with the room. From what I understand rooms in New York can be quite small so we was pleasantly surprised. For the price we paid this is great value. If you are looking for pure luxury - look elsewhere. If you are looking for a comfortable 3 star in a good location with pleasant staff and a decent sized, clean and comfortable room then this is what you get
reviews.title: Great Location and would recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on the 17th floor and had a little kitchenette with coffee maker - coffee suplied - also microwave. The bathroom was small - as other reviewers have said - but it had everything and there was nothing to complain about. Shower was very good.
reviews.title: Great time, Great hotel!

likes.disliked: — Price (if we would have paid the hotel's prices, but we used Priceline)

reviews.text: We arrived a little early but our room was ready and we were able to check in. We were also allowed to check out a little later when departing which was great - they held our bags after that.
reviews.title: Hated it!

likes.liked: — Location near Times Square and Theatre District

reviews.text: We never had problem with the lifts - probably as we were on the top floor. Once it arrived up it was usually empty - however when it stopped at the various floors on the way down - it was often full. Lifts are definitely small.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: We had breakfast included in the price and it was very good. It would be very expensive it if were not included. Continental was about $13 and full american was nearly $20. The continental included tea, coffee, breads, cakes, cereal, fruit, cheese etc. The American had in addition suasage, bacon, eggs, home fries, pancakes, french toast. Plently places close by for breakfast otherwise.
reviews.title: Great location

likes.liked: — size of the room - huge for New York

reviews.title: Not what we had hoped...
reviews.text: I stayed at the belvedere a few weeks ago and unfortunately, I was not informed that there would be extensive construction going on at the time. They first put us in a room that was so loud and actually vibrated from all the work happening on the floor below. The rooms are small, the elevators even smaller and the bed are uncomfortable. The internet connection is extremely slow and good luck with the elevators. Overall, I was hoping this hotel would be a clean, comfortable place to stay based upon reviews, but I was really disappointed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for five nights in early February. The room was very small but comfortable. Bathroom was tiny but very clean and was kept that way by the housekeeping staff. They did an excellent job each day. We booked directly with the Hotel and took advantage of an attractive rate that included a full american breakfast buffet every morning. This was quite nice and well prepared even though by the fifth morning the menu was getting a bit stale. The location is very convenient to Time Square and many restaurants in the area are attractive compliments to the hotel. Bell and Door staffs were very accomodating and concierge services were avaialble if needed. We would stay here again but if I had to do it over, I would certainly ask if they had a bit larger room. Not the best, but all in all, a pleasent stay.
reviews.title: Belvedere- slightly above average
The Internet?? No Room Service!!
reviews.text: Well It is not that anything horrible happened but some things could have been different.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First let me say the Hotel was
reviews.title: Very dissappointed, how did it rate so well on trip advisor?

likes.disliked: — Over rated by trip advisor fellows

reviews.text: *clean
reviews.title: A very good tourist hotel

likes.liked: — Reasonably priced, comfortable hotel in central location

description: Located in the heart of New York City’s theater district, The Belvedere Hotel in Manhattan is a hidden jewel within walking distance of Broadway’s best theaters. Built during the 1920’s Art Deco period, The Belvedere Hotel impresses guests with its elegant ambiance and comfortable lodging accommodations, all complemented by a friendly and helpful staff. The Belvedere’s spacious rooms, earthy tones, and endless amenities provide a relaxing retreat from the bright lights of the big city.The Belvedere’s central location in midtown Manhattan offers easy access to the best the Big Apple has to offer, including Broadway shows, fine dining, unparalleled shopping, and historic landmarks. Whether you’re traveling to New York City for business or pleasure, this luxurious hotel has something for everyone. Its room service, dining options, fitness center, business center, and special offers will make your stay at The Belvedere a central part of what is sure to be an unforgettable visit to New York City.
